info.name: Communications Manager - Sandbox
info.description:
This collection allows you to run a number of pre-generated requests to simulate responses from our sandbox environment.

This environment requires no authentication and no upfront setup for you to use.

For more information on the Communications Manager API please refer to [the documentation](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/communications-manager).

item.name: Send Message Batches
Validation Errors

request.description: This responses sends 0 message objects in the messages collection triggering the too few items error.
This request sends two message objects with the same `messageReference` value. This triggers a duplicate items error.
This request sends a null `type` and a null `recipient` on the request, triggering the null value error.
This request sends several invalid values on properties. Each of these triggers its own invalid value error.
This request misses the `type` and the `messageBatchReference` properties. This triggers the missing property error.
This request sends through an invalid JSON body payload, which triggers the invalid value error at the body level.
This request sends an invalid routing plan id. As the system cannot find this routing plan it triggers a 404 error.

item.description: This folder contains example requests that trigger validation errors when attempting to send a batch of messages.

request.description: This request successfully creates a message batch.

item.name: 201 - Message Batch Created - Free-text NHS App

request.description: This request successfully creates a message batch using the NHS App free-text global routing plan.
This request successfully creates a message batch using the email free-text global routing plan.
This request successfully creates a message batch using the SMS free-text global routing plan.

item.description: This folder contains requests that allow you to simulate all of the different responses when sending a batch of messages.

item.name: Errors
Timeouts & Quotas

request.description: This request simulates the request timeout error response from the API.
This request simulates the too many requests error response from the API.
This request simulates the gateway timeout error response from the API.
This request simulates the retry too early error response from the API.

item.description: This collection of requests shows how to trigger timeout and quota errors.

item.name: Authentication errors

request.description: This request simulates the unauthorized error response from the API.
This request simulates the forbidden error response from the API.
This request simulates the client service ban error response from the API.

item.description: This collection of requests shows how to trigger authentication and authorization errors.

item.name: Mime type errors

request.description: This request asks the server to generate a response that it cannot, triggering a not acceptable error.
This request attempts to send data in an unknown format, triggering an unsupported media error.

item.description: This collection of requests shows how to trigger mime type errors.
This folder contains all requests related to errors that the API can throw on any endpoint.

request.description: This request sends several invalid values on properties. Each of these triggers its own invalid value error.
This request sends through an invalid JSON body payload, which triggers the invalid value error at the body level.
This request misses the `type` and the `messageReference` properties. This triggers the missing property error.
This request sends a null `type,` `routingPlanId,` `messageReference` and `nhsNumber` on the request, triggering the null value error.
This request sends an invalid routing plan id. As the system cannot find this routing plan it triggers a 404 error.
This request sends a routing plan id that references a duplicate template. This routing plan triggers a 500 error.
This request sends a routing plan id that references a missing template. This routing plan triggers a 500 error.
This request successfully creates a message.
This request successfully creates a message using the NHS App free-text global routing plan.
This request successfully creates a message using the email free-text global routing plan.
This request successfully creates a message using the SMS free-text global routing plan.
This request successfully retrieves a message status.

response.name: 200 - All Channels - SMS Delivered
200 - All Channels - Letter Delivered
200 - All Channels - NHS App Delivered
200 - NHS App - Delivered
200 - NHS App - Delivered
200 - NHS App - Sending
200 - NHS App - Failed reason: NHS number not found
200 - NHS App - Failed reason: Contact detail is missing
200 - NHS App - Failed reason: NHS number not found
200 - Email - Delivered
200 - Email - Sending
200 - Email - Failed reason: Contact detail is missing

200 - Email - Failed reason: The provider could not deliver the message. This can happen when the recipients inbox is full or their anti-spam filter rejects your email. Check your content does not look like spam before you try to send the message again.
200 - SMS - Delivered
200 - SMS - Sending
200 - SMS - Failed reason: Contact detail is missing
200 - SMS - Failed reason: Contact detail is missing
200 - Letter - Delivered
200 - Letter - Sending
200 - Letter - Failed reason: Contact detail is missing
200 - Letter - Failed reason: We had an unexpected error while sending the letter to our printing provider.
200 - Failed reason: Patient record invalidated.
200 - Failed reason: Patient is formally dead
200 - Failed reason: Patient is informally dead
200 - Failed reason: Patient has exit code
200 - Failed reason: Patient does not exist in PDS
200 - Failed reason: Name response is invalid: Contact detail is malformed

200 - Failed reason: The provider could not deliver the message. This can happen when the recipients phone is off, has no signal, or their text message inbox is full. You can try to send the message again. Youll still be charged for text messages to pho
200 - Parallel send - NHS App Failed and SMS Delivered

request.description: This request attempts to retrieve a message that does not exist
The request succesfully retreives NHS numbers registered for notifications in the NHS app against an ODS code

response.name: 200 - NHS App Account - T0001 returns the same data as X26

request.description: The request successfully retrieves NHS numbers registered for notifications in the NHS App against an ODS code, adding the "page" parameter allows you to access the full paginated response
The request returns a 400 invalid code when an invalid ODS code is provided
The request returns a 404 not found code when a user attempts to access data that does not exist
The request returns a simulated 429 error for too many requests
The request returns a 502 simulation for bad gateway
A request showing the CORS header responses.
This request triggers a 404 not found error.
